products.title: Balance (worsted)
products.description:
Worsted Weight

Fiber Content: 50% certified organic merino, 50% certified organic cotton
Put-up (two options): 1.75 oz / 50g or 3.5 oz / 100g
Yardage (two options): 130 yds / 120m or 260 yds / 240m
Gauge: 17 - 21 sts = 4” / 10cm
Needle: 5 - 9 US / 3.75 - 5.5mm

Click here for patterns in Balance

Want to see all of the colors in person before ordering? Order a Shade Card.

Want your yarn wound into balls? Look here.

Balance offers a unique, tweedy appearance due to its fiber blend. Its certified organic cotton, grown in Texas, offers breathability and smoothness. Its certified organic merino adds body, warmth, and spring. Processed in Midwestern and Northeastern USA in accordance with organic guidelines, with the exception of specific colors indicated with an asterisks (*) as stated above.

Machine wash in cold water, gentle cycle, in lingerie bag with gentle detergent. Lay flat to dry. Due to the blend of fiber in this yarn, it takes up dye more "tonally" and less "level". Think of this more like a hand-dyed yarn - alternate skeins while knitting.

products.title: 60% off O-Wash Sport Seconds quality
products.description:
The yarns in this section are 2nds quality and are being sold at a 60% discount. If you have a use for imperfect skeins, this is a wonderful deal!

Click here for details on the O-Wash Sport yarn

These yarns are FINAL SALE and have any of the following problems:
Tangled skeins (this is the majority of seconds)
Dirty spots
Marled/candy cane dye effect
Uneven dyeing
Under-dyed
Skeins that bleed
Overspun yarn
Underspun yarn
Felted spots
Last few skeins of a dye lot
Short skeins 

I cannot send photos of the specific skeins, but can try to answer basic questions if you email info@o-wool.com. For the most part, you'll have to take what you get. That's all part of the fun, right?

products.title: Yarn for Verdon
products.description:
The Yarn for Verdon kit includes 8 skeins of Rosy Green Wool Merino d'Arles - 2 skeins each of 4 colors.

Get more info about Merino d'Arles or choose your own unique color combo here!

This listing include the yarn only and not the pattern -  Purchase your Verdon pattern by Melanie Berg here!
